intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium subalpestrifrons, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellowish to reddish flowers and is typically found in alpine and subalpine regions. The plant has basal and upright stems with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Hieracium subalpestrifrons plays a role in stabilizing soil in mountainous areas and is often found in meadows and rocky slopes.
